To complete and sign PDF forms, open the form in Acrobat and then select  E-Sign  from the global bar. You can now fill in the form fields and sign the form using the sign tools described in the following topics. Alternatively, you can select  All tools  >   Fill & Sign .

The timestamp capability and native support for long-term validation of signatures (introduced in Acrobat 9.1) is in compliance with Part 4 of the PAdES standard. Acrobat and Acrobat Reader support XML data signatures that are used to sign data in XML Forms Architectures (XFA) forms. XML data signatures conform to the W3C XML-Signature standard. Like PDF digital signatures, XML digital signatures ensure integrity, authentication, and non-repudiation in documents.
